title: Learning to model
text: There was a lot of 3D going on within OMAX so I needed to learn how to model. I started by watching videos and then set a goal to model at least one object a day. I would find any random object online and try to model it.

title: Using 3D to help design 2D Application
text: I experimented with enhancing the user experience by adding 3D images.

title: Designing the 3D simulator
text: Our 3D Developer was creating a cut simulator so I used 3DS MAX to design the experience.

title: Interacting with 3D objects inside 2D application
text: I also experimented with concepts that would let users interact with some of the operations. One such operation is pathing. For a machine to cut, it needs a path and that path is typically created automatically. However, users can modify it to fit their needs.
Machines also need to know the material to adjust the water pressure accordingly. I also saw this as a perfect opportunity to let the user see what the object would look like after cutting.
Depending on many factors such as object size and path, cuts could fail or produce an end result that doesn't match specs. I experimented with ideas to expose issues before the object was cut.

title: AR/VR Concepts
text: I was asked to come up with some AR/VR concepts to showcase how it can benefit users.

For VR, I saw some potential value in training and help. The image below is a 3D wireframe where the middle square represents a waterject. The idea here is that a user could interact with the machine to learn more about it's components.
Most of my work in AR/VR were concept designs meant to spark ideas and to keep management motivated on the idea.
